articles.author: Gabriel Stargardter
articles.description: Michel Barnier, a veteran politician who was formerly the European Union's Brexit negotiator, will be the shortest serving prime minister in modern French history.
articles.title: Barnier expected to resign as France's festering political crisis rumbles on

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: South Korea's parliament formally introduced a motion on Thursday to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over a botched attempt to impose martial law, but his party vowed to oppose the move, throwing the process into doubt.
articles.title: South Korean ruling party to oppose Yoon's impeachment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: New York police were searching on Thursday for the man who shot dead UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson in a brazen attack outside a Midtown Manhattan hotel and was last seen fleeing into Central Park.
articles.title: New York police hunt for man who killed UnitedHealth executive

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: A month before turning 18, Kyiv native Roman Biletskyi left his family and boarded a train westwards to escape Ukraine and any prospect of fighting in its grinding war.
articles.title: Ukraine's teenage boys fear a dark dilemma: Fight or run

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Syrian rebels said they had started pushing into Hama, a major city where pro-government forces backed by intense Russian air strikes are trying to stave off a new rebel victory and halt the insurgents' lightning advance.
articles.title: Syrian rebels say they have begun to enter crucial city of Hama

articles.author: Yimou Lee
articles.description: China is trying to set a "red line" for the incoming Trump administration and U.S. allies by stepping up military activities in the region, a senior Taiwan security official said, including likely war games this weekend around the island.
articles.title: Taiwan official says China trying to set a 'red line' for incoming Trump government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and his outgoing U.S. counterpart Antony Blinken are due to face off over the war in Ukraine on Thursday at an annual meeting of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) in Malta.
articles.title: US's Blinken, Russia's Lavrov to face off at OSCE meeting in Malta

articles.author: Josh Smith
articles.description: When South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol declared martial law, lawmakers from the main opposition party raced special forces soldiers to the parliament building to hold a vote against the measures.
articles.title: How Lee Jae-myung and South Korean opposition rallied in defiance of martial law

articles.author: David Shepardson, Allison Lampert
articles.description: A global blueprint for modern air travel struck 80 years ago this week faces fresh tests managing change and rising air traffic in the developing world, a senior official at the UN's aviation agency told Reuters.
articles.title: UN aviation agency at 80 challenged by climate change, rising traffic

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump in late November pledged tariffs on the United States' three largest trading partners - Canada, Mexico and China - detailing how he will implement campaign promises that could trigger trade wars.
articles.title: Global companies likely to be affected by Trump's promised tariffs
